intro: Moussonia formosa, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a small shrub or herb, often with a compact, bushy appearance. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
